\begin{abstract}
We consider two-dimensional Yang-Mills theories on arbitrary
Riemann surfaces. We introduce a  generalized Yang-Mills action,
which coincides with the ordinary one on flat surfaces but differs from it
in its coupling to two-dimensional gravity.
The quantization of this theory in the unitary gauge can be consistently
performed taking into account all the topological sectors arising from
the gauge-fixing procedure. The resulting theory is naturally interpreted
as a Matrix String Theory, that is as a theory of covering maps from a
two-dimensional world-sheet to the target Riemann surface.\\
